subject: Re: [junit] PrivateAccessor - Failed static method invocation?
msgSnippet: ... The method you want to test is not static. There are two overloads for the function invoke in the class PrivateAccessor, one for static methods, one for
messageBody:
leephilipreilly wrote:

> [snip]
> I have the following method:
>
> private void doSomething(Long someValue, String anotherValue) throws
> SomeException
> {
> ...
> }
>
> I'm my test, I do something like:
>
> try {
> PrivateAccessor.invoke(
> MyClass.class,
> "doSomething",
> new Class[] {Long.class,String.class },
> new Object[] {someValue, anotherValue});
> }
>
> catch (Throwable t) {
> System.out.println(t.getMessage());
> }

The method you want to test is not static. There are two overloads for
the function invoke in the class PrivateAccessor, one for static
methods, one for non-static methods. You seem to use the one for static
methods, since the first argument is a Class object, not an object of
your class.

What you should do instead is:

MyClass myObj = new MyClass;
try {
PrivateAccessor.invoke(
myObj,
"doSomething",
new Class[] {Long.class,String.class },
new Object[] {someValue, anotherValue});
}

catch (Throwable t) {
System.out.println(t.getMessage());
}
